result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gordon Lew Gonzales

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gordon Lew Gonzales appeared by video.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Gordon Lew Gonzales.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gordon Lew Gonzales in court, without counsel, out of custody.  Annie Louk for Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for indigency hearing.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender's representation.  Defendant requested additional time to obtain counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gordon Lew Gonzales in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Status. Defendant was not able to hire a private and needs more time. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a indigency hearing in the trial court.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gordon Lew Gonzales in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Gonzales is not eligibile for SPD appointment of counsel and has not retained counsel. Defendant would like more time to hire an attorney. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for status.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Gordon Lew Gonzales in court with student intern Simon Earle and attorney Connor Romenesko.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-5-2022 @1:30p
